q: What is the primary philosophy of 'React Testing Library'?
o: Tests should resemble how software is used (interact with DOM nodes like a user would)

q: Which tool is typically used as the *Test Runner* in Create React App?

o: Prints the current state of the DOM (HTML) to the console for debugging

q: What is the recommended priority for queries in RTL?

o: It queries elements exposed in the Accessibility Tree, ensuring the app is accessible to screen readers
<button>, <input type='button'>, <input type='submit'>, or elements with role='button'

q: How to wait for an element to appear asynchronously?
What does `queryBy*` return if not found?
What does `getBy*` return if not found?
o: Throws an error containing the current DOM structure
Only when asserting that an element is *NOT* present (e.g. `expect(...).not.toBeInTheDocument()`)
Utility to dispatch DOM events (click, change, etc.) to simulate user interaction
Companion library to RTL that simulates full user interactions (typing, hovering) more realistically than fireEvent
`userEvent.type` triggers hover, click, focus, and keydown/keyup events for each character. `fireEvent` just emits the change.

q: What defines a 'Unit Test' in React?
o: Testing a component in isolation, mocking its dependencies/children

q: What defines an 'Integration Test' in React?
o: Testing how multiple components work together (e.g. Parent + Child + ReduxStore)
Comparing rendered output (JSON/HTML string) against a saved file to detect unexpected changes

q: Command to update Snapshots in Jest?

o: Testing custom hooks that don't render UI directly
Library extending Jest matches with DOM-specific assertions (toBeInTheDocument, toHaveStyle, etc.)

q: How to check if element is disabled?
How to mock a function with Jest?
How to check if mock was called?

o: Ensures all updates related to a unit of work (rendering, effects, timers) are processed before assertions run

q: Do you need manual `act()` with RTL?
o: Generally No. RTL helpers (render, screen, userEvent) wrap calls in `act()` automatically.

q: When might you see 'not wrapped in act' warning?
o: When a state update happens asynchronously (fetch, timeout) *after* your test has finished or outside your await chain
Async helper that retries a callback until it stops throwing or timeout is reached

q: How to test a context provider?
o: Render the Provider with a test consumer (or real child) and assert values in the consumer

q: How to provide Wrapper for `render` (e.g. ThemeProvider)?

o: Unmounting components after each test to prevent side effects affecting other tests. RTL does this automatically.

q: How to debug a specific element?
How to select element by Accessibility Label?
How to select element by Placeholder?
How to select element by Test ID?

o: Use as last resort (escape hatch) if no semantic query (Role, Text, Label) is possible
Creates a mock function similar to jest.fn but also tracks calls to `object[methodName]`
Library intercepting network requests at network level (Service Worker) to mock API responses in tests
Tests use real fetch/axios. Same mocks can be used for Browser logic and Node tests.

q: How to test component throwing error?
o: Suppress console.error, wrap render in Error Boundary, or assert spyOn check
Test Driven Development: Write failing test -> Write code to pass -> Refactor
The TDD cycle. Red (Fail), Green (Pass), Refactor (Clean up).
No, you test the *outcome* (DOM change, API call) that the effect produces
Jest helper to execute currently pending timers (fast forward)
Rendering only the component, not its children. Discouraged in modern React testing (RTL).
Tests become coupled to implementation details (internal structure) instead of user behavior. False confidence.
Returns an ARRAY of elements matching the role. Throws if none found.
Returns array of elements or empty array `[]` if none found (does not throw)

q: How to test checking a checkbox?

o: Scopes queries to a specific element: `within(form).getByRole('button')`

q: How to upload file in test?

o: Groups related tests (it/test blocks) together. Can have nested scopes.
Hook running before every test in the current describe block (setup)
Hook running once after all tests in the block complete (teardown)
To ensure mock state (call counts) doesn't leak between tests
Clear clears call history. Reset clears history AND implementation (returns undefined).

q: How to check if element has class?

o: Runs ONLY that specific test (skips others). Good for debugging.
Skips the test. Marked as pending.
Placeholder for a future test. Shows up in summary as todo.
Folder for manual mocks that Jest automatically uses when mocking the corresponding module
List of modules to format snapshot output (e.g. emotion-jest-serializer to format styles)

q: How to check if element has focus?

To test how component reacts to prop updates (e.g. `useEffect` running on prop change)
Helper to format DOM element string for debugging (used by screen.debug)
Helper to print DOM tree with ARIA roles to console. Helps find correct `getByRole` query.

q: Does Jest run tests in parallel?
o: Yes, it uses worker processes to run test files in parallel
Configures Jest to use JSDOM (browser environment simulation in Node) for DOM APIs to work
No, it's a JS implementation of web standards. No layout/paint engine (layout calc is mocked/limited).
Mock/Resize window properties and dispatch 'resize' event (JSDOM handles it)
Metric showing % of code executed during tests (Statements, Branches, Functions, Lines)
Did tests execute both 'if' AND 'else' paths?
RTL queries work on `document.body` by default, so portals (usually appended to body) are found automatically
JSDOM polyfills it, or mock `window.localStorage.setItem` to assert calls

q: What is strict mode 'double invoke' purpose in tests?
o: Happens in Dev/Test env to catch side-effects. Tests should pass despite this.
End-to-End (E2E) testing framework running in real browser (Chrome/Electron)
Cypress tests the fully running app (integration/E2E). RTL tests components in memory (unit/integration).
Navigates the test browser to root URL
No, commands are chained (fluent API) and queued automatically. `cy.get().click()`
E2E testing framework by MS. Supports multiple browsers (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit). Uses async/await.

q: How to debug tests in VSCode?
o: Use 'Jest Runner' extension or Launch Config to break points in test files
Test passes sometimes, fails others (race conditions, network timing, non-isolated state). Bad.

To ensure no React warnings (like missing keys, prop types) or unhandled errors occurred during render

q: How to debug Jest timeout issues?
o: Increase timeout per test (`test('name', fn, 10000)`), check for non-resolving promises/timers
Creates a mock function similar to jest.fn but also tracks calls to `object[methodName]`
returnValue gives static value. Implementation takes a function (dynamic logic based on args).
Used inside `jest.mock` to import the original module (partial mocking)

`jest-axe`. Asserts no accessibility violations in rendered HTML.
Import `toHaveNoViolations` from jest-axe, extend expect, run `await axe(container)`

q: What is 'White Box' vs 'Black Box' testing?
o: White box knows internals (state/methods). Black box tests public interface (props/DOM). RTL encourages Black Box.
Verifying component renders correctly given specific props (part of Unit testing)

q: How to test 'Custom Event' handler prop?
o: Pass `jest.fn()` as prop, trigger event via UI (click), assert mock was called
Similar to RTL `screen.debug()`. Prints component tree.
Mount renders full DOM (integration). Shallow renders one level. RTL `render` is like `mount`.

Maps module paths (aliases) or mocks static assets (styles/images) to stubs

q: How to handle CSS imports in Jest?
o: Map them to `identity-obj-proxy` or a dummy mock in `moduleNameMapper` (since Node can't parse CSS)

q: What happens if you don't mock CSS modules in Jest?
o: SyntaxError: Unexpected token (Jest tries to parse CSS as JS)

It is isolated, allows setting `initialEntries` (start URL) easily. Doesn't affect global window history.

q: How to assert a Promise rejection?
How to assert a Promise resolution?
What if you forget `await` in test?
o: Test might finish before promise resolves (false positive) or fail with unhandled rejection later
Check `screen.debug()`, check async timing (need waitFor?), check query correctness (typo, casing)

q: What implies `Unable to find an element with the text`?
o: `getByText` failed. Element is not in DOM (yet/anymore) or text mismatch.

q: What implies `Found multiple elements with the text`?
o: `getByText` failed because it expects EXACTLY ONE match. Use `getAllByText` or refine query.

q: How to select first of multiple matches?
o: `screen.getAllByRole('button')[0]` (Though usually better to use more specific query like name)
Filters by accessible name (e.g. button text or aria-label). `getByRole('button', { name: /save/i })`
It promotes robustness (matches visible text) and uniqueness without ambiguity
Allows querying elements hidden from accessibility tree (display: none, aria-hidden). Default is `false` (only visible).
Not by default with `getByRole`. Use `{ hidden: true }`.

q: Does hover trigger CSS `:hover` in JSDOM?
o: No, JSDOM doesn't handle layout/paint styles (pseudo classes). You can test JS events (onMouseEnter), not styles.
Mock the API (assign `window.IntersectionObserver = class { observe() {}, ... }`) and trigger callbacks manually
DOM API watching for changes. RTL uses it internally for `waitFor` and `findBy`.

q: How to suppress console warnings in specific test?

o: Testing the default, successful user flow (e.g. fill form -> submit -> success)
Testing boundaries, empty states, error states, large inputs
To test cleanup logic (useEffect return) specifically
Scripts running ONCE before/after all test suites (e.g. spinning up test DB container)

q: Can you use Hooks inside tests (e.g. `useMemo`)?
o: No, hooks must be inside components. Use `renderHook(() => useMemo(...))`

q: How to test Redux connected component?
o: Wrap component in `<Provider store={store}>` (use custom render helper to inject store)
To automatically wrap rendered components with all global providers (Theme, Redux, Router) in every test
Async helper awaiting element disappearance (e.g. loading spinner)
Correct. Waits until callback throws error (element gone).
Yes, e.g. check for 'Loading', then check for 'Success' message
Clears cache of required modules. Ensures next require/import gets fresh module execution.
When testing module initialization side-effects or simulating different env vars per test

q: How to run a single test file?

o: `jest --watch`. Reruns tests related to changed files on extra save.

q: How does Jest know which tests are related?
o: Dependency graph (static analysis of imports) + Git status
Experimental running of tests within a single file in parallel (careful with shared state!)

q: Safe way to simulate user typing 'ABC'?

o: Yes, behaves like real typing (appends at cursor, replaces selection)

q: How to test drag and drop?
o: Complex. RTL lacks full native DnD support. Use specialized libs or fire mouse events (down, move, up) manually.
Introducing random failures (delays, errors) to ensure resilience. Not standard unit testing.
Feeding invalid/random data to inputs to find crashes
`babel-jest` is automatically used if Babel config exists. Transpiles tests/source to Node-compatible JS.
Experimental/Partial. Often requires `NODE_OPTIONS=--experimental-vm-modules` or using transforms.
Standard conventions Jest looks for by default
Fixed state/data used as a baseline for running tests (e.g. strict sample JSON)

q: When to use Snapshot vs Assertion?
o: Assertion for specific logic (2+2=4). Snapshot for complex output structure (UI rendering) correctness.
Developers mindlessly update them ('u') without verifying changes, masking bugs

q: How to snapshot large objects partially?

o: `/** @jest-environment jsdom */` at top of file overrides default env for that file
Yes, usually treats `{ a: 1, b: undefined }` same as `{ a: 1 }` depending on version/config, but generally strict value check.
Verifying that recent changes haven't broken existing functionality
Basic checks to ensure critical functions work (app launches). 'Did it catch fire?'
Quick check after build to verify a fix works before full regression suite

q: How to test an infinite loop component?
o: Tests will likely timeout and fail. Don't write infinite loops.

q: Why do async tests fail with 'Network Error'?
o: JSDOM has no real network. Must mock fetch/axios/XHR.
`jest.enableAutomock()`. Automatically mocks all imported modules. Often too aggressive.
Scoped block where modules are fresh loaded. `jest.isolateModules(() => { const m = require('m'); ... })`

q: Best practice for test file location?
o: Co-location (`MyComp.test.js` next to `MyComp.js`) or `__tests__` folder. Co-location preferred for visibility.

q: What is `React.act` behavior in concurrent React 18?
o: `act` recursively flushes effects and microtasks. It might need `await` if the update triggers a transition or suspense fallback.
Render component that suspends (mocks promise not resolving immediately). Assert fallback presence. Then resolve promise. Assert content.

q: How to simulate 'offline' mode in tests?
o: Mock `navigator.onLine` getter and dispatch 'offline' event on window
Helper to cast a function to `JestMock` type for typescript intellisense on mock methods (mockReturnValue, etc)
create a `Bomb` component that throws error. Render inside ErrorBoundary. Assert fallback UI. Suppress console.error.
Writing test titles during planning phase without implementation. Reminds you what to cover.
Asserts that a mock function was called with specific arguments
Asserts that a mock function returned a specific value
Render, update component, check if ref.current value remains stable (same instance)
Sets internal name of mock. Useful for clearer error messages ('Expected myFunc to be called').
Configures Jest to retry failing tests n times before marking as failed (helps with flaky tests, but masking root cause)

q: How to debug Jest memory leak?
o: Run with `--detectLeaks --runInBand` and observe heap usage. Look for undeleted event listeners or global mocks.
Marks a test as expected to fail. Passes if it fails. Fails if it passes.

q: How to mock a CSS media query?
o: Mock `window.matchMedia` implementation to return matches: true/false based on query string

q: How to test dragging multiple items?
o: Simulate dragstart on A, dragenter on B, drop on B. Ensure dataTransfer mock is handled if logic depends on it.

q: Can you test `canvas` with standard JSDOM?
o: Limited. `jest-canvas-mock` adds some support. Real visual checks require E2E or snapshotting to image.
Verifying that API consumer and provider agree on format (e.g. PACT). Ensures frontend doesn't break when backend changes.
Generating thousands of random inputs (using libs like `fast-check`) to verify properties (invariants) always hold
Mock the translation function `t('key')` to return 'key' or fixed string. Or use a test provider with fake translations.

Difficult in JSDOM (limited iframe support). Better suited for Cypress/Playwright.
Config to ignore certain paths (e.g. node_modules, build output) from test discovery
Glob pattern specifying which files should be included in coverage report (even if not tested)

Yes, attaches debugger (Chrome DevTools) to Jest process. useful for debugging tests logic.
Library adding more matchers (toBeArray, toBeBoolean, toBeAfter, etc.)

q: How to test a 'controlled input' behavior?
o: Type into input, assert value prop changed (or state updated). If onChange handler is broken, input won't update.

q: What implies `Warning: An update to App inside a test was not wrapped in act`?
o: You triggered a state update (often async) that you didn't await for. The test finished while React was still working.

q: How to fix 'not wrapped in act' for async effect?
o: Ensure you `await waitFor` the result of that effect (e.g. text appearing) before test ends
Mock `URL.createObjectURL` and `HTMLAnchorElement.prototype.click`. Assert anchor href and click call.
Mocks CSS Modules imports. `import s from 's.css'; s.foo` returns string 'foo' instead of undefined.

q: How to verify strict props type (TypeScript)?
o: Not done at runtime (Jest). Done by TSC check before running tests. Testing runtime prop-types library is separate.
Using `snapshot-diff` library to compare two values/components and snapshot ONLY the difference
Reduces noise in snapshot files. Instead of snapshotting full component, snapshot 'renders X when prop is Y' vs default.
Hard in JSDOM. Use E2E framework or mock the ServiceWorkerContainer API.
`mock` is hoisted (runs before imports). `doMock` is not hoisted (can be used inside tests + requires isolateModules/resetModules).
When you need to mock a module differently for creating different test scenarios within same file (rare)
It requires `Suspsense`. In test, wait for lazy component to load (`findBy`). Ensure test environment supports dynamic import.

q: What makes a test High Value?
o: Tests critical user flows, is resilient to refactors (implementation agnostic), and fails only when product is broken
No. It generally leads to diminishing returns and brittle tests testing implementation details. Aim for high confidence.

q: How to assert class component state?
o: Discouraged (White Box). If needed, Enzyme allowed `wrapper.state()`. RTL does not support direct state access.

q: How to test a 'Thunk' action creator?
o: It returns a function `dispatch => ...`. Call it with a mock dispatch and assert dispatch logic.
Sagas yield objects (instructions). You can iterate generator and assert yielded effects (`redux-saga-test-plan` simplifies this).
Render element. Trigger `userEvent.click(document.body)`. Assert element closed/handler called.
Committing `test.only` prevents other tests from running in CI (false pass). Use strict lint rules to prevent this.

q: How to check if element is visible?
o: `expect(el).toBeVisible()`. Checks display, visibility, opacity, hidden attribute, details element open state.

q: What is `React.Children` map vs regular map?
o: React.Children.map flattens the children prop (handling nested arrays/fragments) and handles null/undefined automatically
Array containing arguments for every call to the mock function `[[arg1, arg2], [arg1_call2]]`
Array of `this` context for each call (if instantiated with `new`)

q: How to clear only one mock?
What implies `ReferenceError: document is not defined` in test?
o: Test is running in 'node' environment instead of 'jsdom'. Change testEnvironment config.
Mock it first (JSDOM doesn't implement it). `window.scrollTo = jest.fn()`. Then assert calls.
Plugin to filter tests by filename or test name pattern with autocomplete in watch mode

q: How to assert strict array equality order?

o: Convert to Set or sort both before expect, or `expect(arr).toEqual(expect.arrayContaining([1, 2]))`
Each test runs independently. State (DOM, Mocks, Variables) is reset so test A doesn't affect test B.

q: Does RTL clean document body automatically?
o: Yes, `cleanup` runs after each test (if testing-library/react is imported globally or setupFilesAfterEnv)

q: What is `screen.queryByText` useful for if not asserting absence?
o: Generally not useful. Use `getByText` for presence assertions (better error message).
Temporarily modifying a global/module method logic for a test. `Original = Obj.fn; Obj.fn = Mock; ... restore()`

q: Why is `jest.spyOn` better than simple monkey patch?
o: It allows easy `mockRestore()` to original implementation automatically
`jest.mock(...)`, then customize `useLocation` mock return value per test to simulate different URLs

q: What is 'Flaky Test' common cause - Animations?
o: Test asserts presence before animation completes. Use `waitFor` or disable animations in test env.

q: How to disable animations for tests?
o: Mock animation library or inject global CSS `* { transition: none !important; animation: none !important; }`
The default test runner mechanism in Jest (replaced Jasmine). Handles describe/test execution order.

q: How to debug unhandled promise rejection in tests?
o: Add listener to `process.on('unhandledRejection')` or ensure `expect.assertions(n)` matches logic
Verifies that a certain number of assertions were called. Essential for testing async code (callbacks/promises) to ensure test didn't exit early.
Ensures at least one assertion was called in the test
Replacing the inner logic of a function to do something else (e.g. return immediately) during test

q: How to mock resolved value once?

o: To simulate different responses in sequence (e.g. Success then Error retry)
Directories Jest searches for modules (defaults to `node_modules`). Add 'src' for absolute imports.

q: How to mock `Date` globally but keep ability to use real Date?
o: Save `RealDate = Date`. Override `global.Date`. Restore in teardown.
Restores original timer functions (setTimeout) if `useFakeTimers` was called

q: Can you combine TDD and BDD?
o: Yes. BDD (Behavior Driven) describes 'Given/When/Then' (specs) which you implement via TDD cycle.
Allows mocking modules that don't exist on disk (virtual: true).

q: How to test component that measures DOM (`getBoundingClientRect`)?
o: JSDOM mocks return all 0s. You must mock `getBoundingClientRect` on the element prototype or specific instance.

q: How to assert strict equality of objects?

o: Returns the mock module instead of actual (useful if you need to access mock state explicitly)
Matching dynamic fields (IDs, Dates) in snapshot with `expect.any(String)` to avoid snapshot churn

q: How to test error thrown in async function?

Stop running tests after `n` failures. Fast fail.
Configuration ensuring build fails if coverage drops below %
Yes, batteries-included (runner, assertion lib, mocking lib, coverage). Unlike Mocha which needs plugins.

Configuration to set default timeout (5000ms). Can be set per test/file.

q: How to verify component throws during render?
o: `expect(() => render(<Comp />)).toThrow()` - Note: Prevent React logging error to console to keep test clean (spyOn/mock).
Prevents printing to console during tests. Useful for clean CI logs.
MouseDown -> Advance Timer (delay) -> MouseUp. Check handler.
Exposed garbage collector (if node run with --expose-gc). Used in memory leak tests.

q: How to mock `localStorage` getItem to return null?
What is 'Inversion of Control' in testing?
o: Components receiving dependencies (services/stores) via props/context allow easy swapping with mocks during tests.
Use `Object.defineProperty` to add setter spy (JSDOM location is tricky). Or use `delete window.location` trick (legacy).
Render. Assert `innerHTML` or contained element presence. Be careful with XSS if testing untrusted input logic.
To extend original implementation instead of replacing fully. e.g. adding one tracked method.

q: How to debug 'Jest worker' out of memory?
o: Use `workerIdleMemoryLimit`, decrease `maxWorkers`, or inspect leak with heap dump.
Runs paramaterized tests in parallel. High throughput for data-heavy tests.
Focus element, then `userEvent.tab()` (focus moves next) or click body. Assert blur handler.
`fireEvent.submit(form)` or click submit button. Assert handler.
Checks if button is disabled/hidden. Fires full event sequence (focus, mouseup, click, submit). More realistic.

q: What implies `TypeError: window.matchMedia is not a function`?
o: JSDOM missing matchMedia. You must mock it in `setupFilesAfterEnv`.

q: How to test component state reset?
o: Interact to change state. Trigger reset (button/prop). Assert state returned to initial.
Writing tests for legacy code to document *current* behavior (even bugs) before refactoring. Safely Lock-in behavior.
Similar to snapshot testing. Verifying output matches 'approved' master version. Often used for text/pdf generation.

q: How to test `React.memo` prop comparison logic?
o: Pass custom `areEqual` function. Test the function directly (Unit). Or integration verify re-render.
Export reducer function. Test it purely (Unit: `reducer(state, action) => newState`). Or integration via component.
Pure functions are easiest to test. Covers all state transitions without UI overhead.

q: How to test `refs` pointing to DOM?
o: Render. Access ref.current. Assert it is an instance of HTMLElement.
Fetch/ServiceWorker concept (no-cors). Cannot read status/body code in test properly if not mocked correctly.
Suppress console.log (spy). Strict mode logs double render warnings (dev only). Not usually tested explicitly.
Exhausts all macrotask queue timers. Dangerous if recursive timers exist (infinite loop).
Running script 'test' with pnpm package manager. Just an alias.
Currently minimal support in standard test renderers. Usually tested via manual mocks of `performance.now` or tracing production builds.

q: How to test 'race condition' in async list?
o: Trigger two fetches. Resolve the second one FIRST. Resolve first one LATER. Assert component shows result of SECOND (latest) fetch.

q: How to fix race condition bug in test?
o: Use `cleanup` flag variable or `AbortController` in `useEffect`. If test shows old data, fix implemented.
Visual checks pixels (CSS/Layout layout). Functional checks behavior (JS logic/DOM structure). Jest/RTL is Functional.
The second argument `() => ({ ... })`. Returns the mocked module content.

q: What if mock factory accesses outer variable?
o: Fails. `jest.mock` is hoisted above imports. Variables must be defined inside factory or start with `mock` prefix.
Jest exception to hoisting rule. Allows `const mockData = ...; jest.mock(..., () => mockData)`.
Mock multiple promises. Resolve all. Assert final state. Reject one. Assert catch state.
Fails test if `value` is truthy. Useful for callbacks `(err) => test.ifError(err)`.

q: How to test component 'recursive' rendering limits?
o: Render deep structure. Assert it stops or renders correctly. Watch out for StackOverflow in JSDOM.
Resolver for Yarn PnP (Plug'n'Play) environments where node_modules doesn't exist.
Use `jest-websocket-mock` or mock `global.WebSocket`. Assert messages sent/received.

q: How to assert specific call argument at index?
What is 'Snapshot Property Matchers' for dynamic usage?
o: `expect(v).toMatchSnapshot({ id: expect.any(String) })`. Useful for UUIDs generated during render.

q: How to test component utilizing `ResizeObserver` loop limit?
o: Difficult. Usually ignored in JSDOM (muted). In E2E, check browser console for 'ResizeObserver loop limit exceeded'.
Preserving parts of the module. `return { ...jest.requireActual('mod'), mockedMethod: ... }`
Yes. `expect(result1).toBe(result2)` verifies object reference is identical (memoized).

q: How to test `Context` updates without rendering unrelated children?
o: Mock the child components to exclude them from render tree/snapshot, isolating the Context Provider logic.
Defining specific behavior for 1st call, then 2nd call, etc. `.mockImplementationOnce(A).mockImplementationOnce(B)`
Pass signal to fetch mock. Trigger abort. Assert fetch rejected with AbortError or cleanup logic ran.
Percentage of control structure branches (if/else/switch cases) executed. Hardest to get to 100%.
Mock dynamic import to reject. Assert Error Boundary catches it.
Runs test in Node environment (no DOM globals like window/document). Faster startup. Good for utility functions.
Yes, set `testEnvironment` in jest config (default) or override per file with docblock.
Mock `window.scrollTo`. Navigate. Assert call with saved coordinates.
Use `jest.useFakeTimers()` (modern Jest mocks RAF automatically) or `jest-raf-stub`.
A mock that throws if any un-configured method is called. Ensures precise behavior verification.
Difficult in Jest runner itself. Often needs a separate child process test or specific mocking of process.
Spy on fetch. Assert `headers` argument contains correct content-type.
Create Image mock. Trigger onload manually. `const img = new Image(); img.onload();`
Simple promise delay. Replaced by `await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r))` or `act`.

q: How to assert error instance type specifically?

o: Assert z-indexes or visually via E2E. Unit test overlays preventing click on under-elements using custom event bubbling checks.
Mock `window.postMessage`. Assert dispatch directly. Use `window.addEventListener('message')` to receive.
Hard in JSDOM (styling logic). Use E2E visual regression for outlines.
Use `jest-axe` `toHaveNoViolations()`. Checks tree for ARIA rules.
Scroll. Check bounding client rect (mocked). Assert position fixed/sticky class applied.
Mock global Worker class. spy on constructor and `postMessage`.
Trigger touch events (touchstart multiple touches, touchmove spread). Calculate scale logic in test.
Disables automatic mocking. Not needed unless automock: true is in config.
Mock `matchMedia('(prefers-reduced-motion: reduce)')`. Assert animation styles disabled or different classes.
Spy on `disconnect`. Unmount component. Assert spy called.

q: What implies 'Test suite failed to run: Cannot find module'?
o: Import path error, missing dependency, or incorrect `moduleNameMapper` config.
Not standard API. Use `jest.retryTimes` configuration for suite or file.

q: How to verify that a state update happened inside a 'transition' (concurrent)?
o: Difficult to inspect transition object directly. Verify behavior: e.g. 'isPending' state appearance or suspension behavior using `act`.
`setMock` is strict/explicit (legacy). `mock` is more flexible/hoisted. Prefer `mock`.
Dispatch 'beforeunload' on window. Assert `event.returnValue` was set or `preventDefault` called.
Jest config to throw (fail test) if deprecated APIs are used (e.g. from React).
Utility used by Jest to print pretty diff strings (green/red) on failure. Can be used standalone.

q: How to test custom 'Hook' throwing error?
o: `const { result } = renderHook(() => useHook()); expect(result.error).toEqual(...)` (if hook catches) or `expect(() => renderHook(...)).toThrow()`

q: What implies `TypeError: Cannot read property 'style' of null` in test?
o: Tried to access style on an element that wasn't found (null). Check query.

q: How to debug 'Async callback was not invoked within timeout'?
o: Callback passed to `done` or async function never finished. Promise stuck pending. Check network mocks/timers.
Run before test framework. CANNOT use `jest.fn`, `expect`, etc inside them.
Mock `WebAssembly.instantiate`. JSDOM support is often missing or basic.
`unmount()` helper from RTL/Enzyme. Or re-rendering parent without the child.
Render without props. Assert values from defaultProps are present in DOM or props (Unit).
Internal package used by Jest to resolve module paths. Supports custom resolvers.
Hard in JSDOM (event bubbling ignores CSS). `userEvent` might respect it if `skipPointerEventsCheck` is false. Usually E2E check.

q: What is a 'Stub' in Sinon terms?
o: Function with pre-programmed behavior (like Jest mock implementation).

q: Can Jest run TS files directly?
o: No, requires transformation (ts-jest or babel-jest) to JS first.
Config (seconds) to mark test as slow (highlighted in red in summary).
Use `DOMParser` (supported in JSDOM). Parse string, assert XML document structure.
JSDOM has basic support. Access `element.shadowRoot`. Queries might need specific config or `within(shadowRoot)`.

q: What implies 'Jest: Timeout - Async callback was not invoked'?
o: Promise/Done callback never finished within limit.

o: Array of objects `{ type: 'return'|'throw', value: ... }` for each call.

Usually natively available in Node 10+ / JSDOM. If not, polyfill global.

q: How to assert element does NOT have class?

o: Capturing actual image of component. Diffing against baseline image. (e.g. Storybook test-runner, specialized tools).
Run async callback with isolated modules registry.
Mock the class. Simulate message event on channel instance.

q: What implies 'Test suite failed to run: Your test suite must contain at least one test'?
o: You have a test file with no `test` or `it` blocks (or all skipped).
Natively supported in Node (with full-icu or newer versions). Verify formatted output string.
List of reporters (default, github-actions, summary, etc) to output test results.

q: How to test 'Network Offline' detection hook?
o: Trigger 'offline' event on window. Assert hook state matches false.
Form submission logic. Spy on fetch body (which is FormData). Check entries.
Often used to flush microtasks in legacy tests. `await new Promise(setImmediate)`.
Mock `window.Notification`. Assert permission request or constructor call.
Automatically resets mock state (calls) before every test. Safer default.
Automatically restores original implementations (for spies) before every test.
Mock `navigator.clipboard.writeText`. Click button. Assert writeText called with expected string.

q: What represents the 'Arrange' phase in test?
o: Setting up mocks, rendering components, defining props.

q: What represents the 'Act' phase in test?
o: Performing user interactions (click, type) or executing function.

q: What represents the 'Assert' phase in test?

o: Setup `expect.extend(matchers)` in `setupFilesAfterEnv` to make new matchers available globally.
Mock `navigator.getBattery`. Return promise resolving to mock battery manager object.
Aliases for the same thing. `xtest` is a shorthand for `test.skip`.

q: How to verify that a mock was NOT called?

o: First call returns first value, second call returns second value, subsequent calls return default (undefined or last implementation).

q: How to test component that registers global event listener?
o: Spy on `window.addEventListener`. Mount. Assert spy called. Unmount. Assert `removeEventListener` called.
How often Jest expects to check the condition (default 50ms).
Run sequentially (`--runInBand`). Use node `--inspect`. Check memory usage.
Marks test as expecting to fail. If it throws, it passes. If it doesn't throw, it fails.

q: How to assert object equality ignoring specific field?

o: Replaces object property (getter/value) and restores it automatically. Cleaner than `Object.defineProperty`.
Dispatch `online`/`offline` event on window. Assert component reaction.
